author: dtb_
content: each block can contain *up to* 64 crosslinks (i.e., can be empty) through a similar attest+aggregate mechanism using beacon chain committees plus data availability sampling (DAS) -- every slot has beacon chain committees assigned to different shards to crosslink in beacon blocks. each validator in a beacon chain committee provides an attestation to both beacon chain block and a shard blob for their assigned shard (where the shard blob is bundled by a blob builder and chosen by a randomly selected, shard-specific blob proposer). there's also a subset of a beacon chain committee's validators used to aggregate attestations (beacon block & shard blob roots, etc.) for beacon block proposers where inclusion follows the same 2/3 & consensus logic. here's vitalik's explanation (re-posted link from above) & the sharding-specific specs for more details: https://hackmd.io/@vbuterin/sharding_proposal#How-does-sharding-work-on-the-P2P-layer & https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/sharding/beacon-chain.md#updated-containers & https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/sharding/p2p-interface.md
